Posts.Content: ThriverInGA wrote: I was just diagnosed with "radiation recall" by my radiologist. Apparently the taxanes (I had my first chemo 9 days ago) can give this SE. The area over my lumpectomy is inflamed red and a bit blistered. It burns and stings! I had Contura brachytherapy following my surgery, then started chemo 3-1/2 weeks after treatment. My radiologist prescribed a corticosteroid cream for it. Has anyone else experienced this SE? How long did your rash last? Dx 8/1/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 8/31/2011 Lumpectomy: Left Radiation Therapy 9/23/2011 Breast Targeted Therapy 11/2/2011 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 11/2/2011 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 2/23/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Radiation Recall with Taxotere ThriverInGA ThriverInGA

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2012 05:24AM ThriverInGA wrote: I used Mederma after my 2008 biopsy, based on the surgeon's recommendation. Now that I've had breast cancer I'm avoiding parabens and other chemicals. This time I am using a product called Scargo, which is natural. I purchased it at Whole Foods. Probably any good natural massage oil would work, as the surgeon says it's the massage over the scar that breaks up the scar tissue, not just the oil.
Posts.Title: Did your doctor recommend you put anything on your scar? finallynow patti3796
